meanings.definition: A person who knows only one language.
meanings.sent1: She is a monoglot and only speaks English.
meanings.sent2: The monoglot struggled to communicate while traveling abroad.
meanings.sent3: The monoglot tried to order food in Spanish but accidentally asked for a shoe instead.
meanings.sent4: His monoglot nature made it challenging for him to connect with people from different cultures.
meanings.sent5: Being a monoglot limited her job opportunities in the global market.

meanings.definition: Using or expressed in only one language.
meanings.sent1: The monoglot menu at the restaurant had no translations.
meanings.sent2: She found it difficult to learn a new language after years of monoglot communication.
meanings.sent3: The monoglot sign confused tourists who couldn't understand the language.
meanings.sent4: His monoglot approach to communication hindered his ability to connect with diverse groups.
meanings.sent5: The monoglot instructions were useless to those who didn't speak the language.
